duties_responsibilities.duty: Complete the PACE SEMI intake process including initial home visits, assessments, and assistance in obtaining Medicaid documents.
Communicate information about PACE SEMI program and other community services to potential participants through home visits and phone contact.
Assess eligibility for enrollment into the PACE SEMI program.
Prepare written communication to Intake team introducing each intake candidate and updating daily on Home Visit results.
Input potential participant’s information and assessments into TruChart.
Communicate regularly with Participant Advocate to ensure Interdisciplinary Team (IDT) has all needed information on the potential participant.
Work closely with eligibility specialist to ensure Medicaid and Medicare eligibility upon intake.
Coordinate timely follow-up with potential participants and their families thorough phone contact when needed.
Keep confidential, all PACE SEMI or prospective PACE SEMI participant information.

education_certification.credential: Master’s degree in Social Work required.
Limited or Full social work license required.
One or more year(s) of experience working with elderly in a community-based setting required.
Basic knowledge of Microsoft windows and Microsoft Outlook
